Identification_Area.title: PDS data processing: Gamma Ray and Neutron Detector

Citation_Information.description: Data processing for the reduction of gamma ray and neutron spectroscopy data acquired by the NASA Dawn mission's Gamma Ray and Neutron Detector (GRaND) is described.

Modification_Detail.description: This document was adapted at the time of PDS4 migration and is unchanged from the latest version of GRaND PDS3 document GRAND_DATA_PROC-130711.PDF from DAWN-A-GRAND-3-RDR-CERES-COUNTS-V1.0, other than the conversion to PDF/A.

Investigation_Area.name: Dawn Mission to Vesta and Ceres

Document.document_name: PDS data processing: Gamma Ray and Neutron Detector
Document.description:
This document describes the data processing steps used to transform Telemetry data acquired by GRaND into Raw and Calibrated data, which is archived by the Planetary Data System (PDS). The data_raw collections are the lowest level of data archived by the PDS and contain instrument housekeeping and science data needed to create higher order data products. The data_raw collections are determined from the Telemetry data using reversible processes. The data_calibrated collections contain data that have been irreversibly transformed to produce calibrated time series data, including pulse height spectra and counting rates that can be used to map elemental abundances at Vesta and Ceres. The GRaND data_calibrated collections time series data include ancillary ephemeris and pointing data needed for mapping.
It was adapted from the Dawn GRaND PDS3 BGO Data Processing document at the time the GRaND PDS3 archive was migrated to PDS4.

Document_Edition.description: This document is conformant to PDF/A.
